title: Pride Of Britain Awards: Lauren Silverman exudes glamour as she cosies up to svelte Simon Cowell
text:
They have been dating for a blissful six years.

And Lauren Silverman, 42, looked as smitten as ever with Simon Cowell as she cosied up to the music mogul, 60, whilst leaving the Pride Of Britain Awards in London on Monday.

The pair drew in a big crowd as they left the Grosvenor House Hotel, with hoards of passers by stopping to ask for selfies with the couple.

Cute: Lauren Silverman, 42, looked as smitten as ever with Simon Cowell as she cosied up to the music mogul, 60, whilst leaving the Pride Of Britain Awards in London on Monday

Lauren looked phenomenal for her night out, showcasing her enviable figure in a strapless black gown adorned with sequins.

Cinching in at her tiny waist, the garment flared out into a chic asymmetric hemline that showed off her barely-there black heels.

The glamorous socialite completed the look by styling her glossy chestnut waves in loose waves that framed her pretty features.

Dressed to impress: Lauren looked phenomenal for her night out, showcasing her enviable figure in a strapless black gown adorned with sequins

Earlier in the night, Simon attended the red carpet for the awards on his own, turning heads with his slimmer physique.

The X Factor and Britain's Got Talent star lost 20Ibs thanks to a strict vegan lifestyle, but his notably slender physique suggested he has since shed even more weight.

Arriving backstage, Simon looked fit and healthy as he posed for photos alongside Dermot O'Leary and Louis Walsh.

Glamorous: Cinching in at her tiny waist, Lauren's gown flared out into a chic asymmetric hemline that showed off her barely-there black heels

Brunette beauty: The glamorous socialite completed the look by styling her glossy chestnut waves in loose waves that framed her pretty features

Mobbed: The pair drew in a big crowd as they left the Grosvenor House Hotel, with hoards of passers by stopping to ask for selfies with the couple

The Britain's Got Talent judge recently admitted during an appearance on The Ellen DeGeneres Show that he drastically changed his diet so he could keep up with Eric.

He said: 'I went to see this doctor in London. We did some tests. And then a month later he said, "You have the worst diet I've ever met from any patient."

'So I went, "Okay, out of the smoking, the drinking, and diet, what do I have to drop?" And he said, "The diet." So I said, "I'm in!"

Trim: Earlier in the night, Simon attended the red carpet for the awards on his own, turning heads with his slimmer physique

Slender: The star lost 20Ibs thanks to a strict vegan lifestyle, but his notably slender physique suggested he has shed even more weight as he posed for photos with Louis Walsh, Dermot O'Leary and Child of Courage winner Jaydee-Lee Dummett

Old times: Simon looked fuller faced at the America's Got Talent premiere in March (L) but his weight loss was evident during his latest appearance on Monday night (R)

'It was easier than I thought, and part of the reason I did it was because of Eric. I realised if I didn't sort myself out physically, I wouldn't be able to catch up with him.

'Because the minute he gets up to the minute he goes to sleep ... their energy, you forget, at five years old, is phenomenal.'

Simon previously said he'd named his diet the Eric Cowell diet after his son, because the youngster loves to munch on raw vegetables.

He said: 'It's like the Eric diet because he actually, apart from ice cream, he actually likes water. I mean, who likes water? And his raw vegetables. So I'm on like, the Eric Cowell diet.'

For a good cause: Simon and his X Factor co-stars supported the annual Pride of Britain event on Thursday evening

More than 100 of the UK's biggest stars came together at the Daily Mirror Pride of Britain Awards to honour the nation's unsung heroes on the landmark 20th anniversary of the event.

The awards recognise and celebrate ordinary people up and down the country doing extraordinary things.

Host Carol Vorderman said: 'Pride of Britain is such a huge part of my life, it's hard to believe it's 20 years since we first started.

'In that time, it has found a place at the heart of British life, and the winners represent the very best of us. I never fail to be humbled by them, and this year's are no different.'

The Daily Mirror Pride of Britain Awards, in partnership with TSB, will be broadcast on ITV on 5th November at 8pm.
